definition: to press down/to calm/to subdue/to suppress/to guard/garrison/small town/to cool or chill (food or drinks)
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

sentences.english: The woman behind me, whoever she is, whispers about sedatives.
sentences.chinese: 我后面的女人，不知道是谁，悄声说着镇静药。

sentences.english: Tranquillisers or anti-depressants, to alleviate the stress of being American.
sentences.chinese: 镇静药和抗抑郁药，以减轻做美国人的压力。

sentences.english: He doctored his drink with sedatives.
sentences.chinese: 他向饮料里掺了镇静药。

sentences.english: Then we will let you have a sound night sleep.
sentences.chinese: 他们将会为你选择最合适的镇静药让你晚上睡个好觉。

sentences.english: What sedatives can be administered to supplement a regional anesthetic?
sentences.chinese: 哪些镇静药可以强化区域麻醉？

sentences.english: No anesthesia is necessary, although some women may wish to have a mild sedative.
sentences.chinese: 不需要麻醉，尽管有些妇女希望服轻微镇静药。

sentences.english: The doctor gave her a sedative medicine and she then slept for eight hours.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她一种镇静药后她睡了八小时。

definition: propranolol (beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure)
propranolol (beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure)
